author: Special Correspondent
text:
Over 200 doctors staged a protest at Madras Medical College on Friday evening. The doctors, members of the Service Doctors and Post Graduates Association, had come from across the State, said N. Lakshmi Narasimhan, president of the association.

The protest was part of an on-going ‘demand badge’ agitation by the doctors for several demands including the conducting of qualifying exams for temporary appointment doctors.

They also demanded the completion of the regularization of doctors recruited through the medical recruitment board; the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission and two years’ child care leave for women doctors and healthcare professionals among others, he said.

“Since the government has taken over Annamalai University, we also want the tuition fees of the undergraduate and postgraduate students there to be the same as that of other government medical colleges. At present it is much higher,” said Dr. Narasimhan.

Memorandum submitted

He said members of the Association had met with the health secretary on Friday and submitted a memorandum with their demands.

“On Saturday, we will start a signature campaign. We are hoping to get signatures from all 15,000 doctors across the State and we will then present our memorandum to the government again,” he said.
title: Hundreds of doctors protest at MMC
